attributes.action: Recognize vaccinations from outside of the UK Programme.
attributes.additional_details: Many of us in Great Britain are from various backgrounds. We have family, friends, expats living in different countries. They cannot visit for a short period of time without quarantine even for serious reasons (Funerals, child-births) even if they are fully vaccinated with the same product as we are here in the UK. This creates an unneccesary difficulty and a two-faced situation where UK aims to create 'Vaccination Passports' that fail recognizing other countries efforts. It's bad diplomacy.
attributes.background: Citizens from outside UK receive the same geniune and recognized Pfizer(a.o) vaccines. Anyone arriving into UK that's vaccinated, but not under the UK programme, have to quarantine for a significant period of their stay, whilist UK Vaccinated individuals do not. It's illogical and confusing.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/592505

You might be interested to know that the Government has indicated it plans to allow foreign nationals who have received a UK-approved vaccine to enter the UK without needing to quarantine: https://inews.co.uk/news/politics/ministers-close-to-allowing-quarantine-free-travel-to-uk-for-fully-vaccinated-foreign-nationals-1122271
